items.content: Observers say Sanae Takaichi's personal popularity may boost the ruling party's showing at the polls.

items.title: Polls open in Japan's parliamentary elections as Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes for big win
items.standfirst: Polls opened Sunday in parliamentary elections that Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes will give her struggling party a big enough win to push through an ambitious conservative political agenda.
items.content: Polls opened Sunday in parliamentary elections that Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes will give her struggling party a big enough win to push through an ambitious conservative political agenda.

items.title: Japan votes in test for PM Takaichi as snow weighs on turnout
items.standfirst: Japanese voters were casting ballots on Sunday in an election expected to hand Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi a resounding win, although record snowfall in parts of the country could keep many voters at home. The conservative coalition of Takaichi, the nation’s first female leader, could win more…

items.content: Polls are predicting a landslide for Sanae Takaichi on Sunday, which would give her direct public backing as she seeks to boost Japan’s defense capabilities.

items.title: Who is Japan's first female PM and can the ultra conservative tighten her grip on power?
items.standfirst: Japan is holding a snap election on Sunday, in the first electoral test for the country's first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, since she became leader.
items.content: Japan is holding a snap election on Sunday, in the first electoral test for the country's first female prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, since she became leader.

items.title: Will Sunday's snap election gamble pay off for Japan's first female premier?

items.content: Sanae Takaichi is popular - but inflation and a diplomatic row with China weigh on voters' minds.

clusters.title: Trump pushes for peace in Ukraine ‘by June’, Zelensky says
clusters.neutral_headline: US Sets June Deadline For Ukraine Russia Peace Deal

items.title: Trump pushes for peace in Ukraine ‘by June’, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday said Washington has proposed that Russian and Ukrainian negotiators meet in the United States next week to discuss a possible peace deal. “They say they want to do everything by June,” Zelensky said of the US mediators.
items.content: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday said Washington has proposed that Russian and Ukrainian negotiators meet in the United States next week to discuss a possible peace deal. “They say they want to do everything by June,” Zelensky said of the US mediators.

items.title: Zelenskyy Says US Gave Ukraine And Russia A June Deadline To End War
items.standfirst: Zelenskyy Says US Gave Ukraine And Russia A June Deadline To End War Authored by Tom Ozimek via The Epoch Times, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Feb. 6 that the United States has given both Ukraine and Russia a June deadline to reach an agreement to end the nearly four-year war,…
items.content: Zelenskyy Says US Gave Ukraine And Russia A June Deadline To End War Authored by Tom Ozimek via The Epoch Times, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Feb. 6 that the United States has given both Ukraine and Russia a June deadline to reach an agreement to end the nearly four-year war,…

items.title: US sets deadline for peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
items.standfirst: The United States wants Kyiv and Moscow to end the nearly four-year war by June, and has offered to host talks between the two sides next week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. If the June deadline is not met, the Trump administration will likely put pressure on both sides to meet it, he added. France24 International Affairs editor Andrew Hilliars explains.
items.content: The United States wants Kyiv and Moscow to end the nearly four-year war by June, and has offered to host talks between the two sides next week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said. If the June deadline is not met, the Trump administration will likely put pressure on both sides to meet it, he added. France24 International Affairs editor Andrew Hilliars explains.

items.title: Zelenskyy says US has set June deadline for Ukraine-Russia peace deal
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president says Trump administration has proposed to host next round of trilateral talks in USVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said the US has given Ukraine and Russia yet another deadline to reach a peace settlement, and is now proposing the war should end by June. The Ukrainian president also told reporters that both sides had been invited to further talks next week.Zelenskyy said the Trump administration “will probably put pressure” on Ukraine and Russia to end the war by the beginning of the summer. “They say they want to get everything done by June,” he said. “They will do everything to end the war and they want a clear schedule of all events.” Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president says Trump administration has proposed to host next round of trilateral talks in USVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said the US has given Ukraine and Russia yet another deadline to reach a peace settlement, and is now proposing the war should end by June. The Ukrainian president also told reporters that both sides had been invited to further talks next week.Zelenskyy said the Trump administration “will probably put pressure” on Ukraine and Russia to end the war by the beginning of the summer. “They say they want to get everything done by June,” he said. “They will do everything to end the war and they want a clear schedule of all events.” Continue reading...

items.title: US has given Ukraine and Russia June deadline to end war: Zelenskyy

items.content: Ukraine's president says the US has also proposed new trilateral talks in Miami, which he said Ukraine will attend.

If the June deadline is not met, the Trump administration will likely put pressure on both sides to meet it, he added. Read our liveblog to see how the day's events unfolded.

clusters.title: Veteran French politician quits as head of prestigious institute after Epstein links revealed
clusters.neutral_headline: French Politician Quits Over Epstein Links

items.title: Veteran French politician quits as head of prestigious institute after Epstein links revealed
items.standfirst: Former culture minister Jack Lang resigns from Arab World Institute in Paris and is also subject of tax investigationJack Lang, a former French culture minister, has resigned as head of Paris’s prestigious Arab World Institute after revelations of his past contacts with the disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and the launch of a financial investigation by French prosecutors.Lang, 86, resigned on Saturday night before he was due to attend an urgent meeting called by the French foreign ministry to discuss his links to Epstein. Continue reading...
items.content: Former culture minister Jack Lang resigns from Arab World Institute in Paris and is also subject of tax investigationJack Lang, a former French culture minister, has resigned as head of Paris’s prestigious Arab World Institute after revelations of his past contacts with the disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and the launch of a financial investigation by French prosecutors.Lang, 86, resigned on Saturday night before he was due to attend an urgent meeting called by the French foreign ministry to discuss his links to Epstein. Continue reading...

items.title: France investigates ex-minister Jack Lang over Epstein links
items.standfirst: The socialist grandee quits his role at a prestigious institute as he is investigated for the "laundering of tax-fraud proceeds".
items.content: The socialist grandee quits his role at a prestigious institute as he is investigated for the "laundering of tax-fraud proceeds".

items.title: France’s former minister Jack Lang ‘offers’ to resign from Arab World Institute over Epstein links
items.standfirst: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.
items.content: Jack Lang, France’s former culture minister, on Saturday “offered” to resign as head of the prestigious Arab World Institute in Paris after he and his daughter Caroline were mentioned in the latest batch of documents related to the late financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The day before, France’s financial crimes prosecutors announced they had opened a probe into the Lang family’s ties with Epstein. Lang is also due to appear before Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot after being summoned.

items.title: Paris probes Jack Lang over Epstein link
items.standfirst: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.
items.content: In France, all eyes are on Jack Lang, who has been summoned to the Quai d’Orsay tomorrow. The president of the Arab World Institute and his daughter, Caroline Lang, are both the subject of an investigation by the financial prosecutor’s office for aggravated money laundering linked to tax fraud. France 2 Benoit Chavatte and France 24 Daniel Quinlan take a closer look.

ai_summary: Jack Lang resigns from Arab World Institute
He faces investigation over Epstein links
Lang also subject to tax investigation
He quit before urgent meeting
His daughter also mentioned in Epstein documents

clusters.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
clusters.neutral_headline: Drone Attack Kills 24 In Sudan

items.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
items.standfirst: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors NetworkA drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors’ group said on Saturday.The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country’s war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...
items.content: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors NetworkA drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors’ group said on Saturday.The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country’s war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...

clusters.neutral_headline: Milano Cortina Winter Olympics Begin

items.title: 2/7: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics are officially underway after Friday's opening ceremony. Plus, the latest on the investigation into Nancy Guthrie's disappearance.
items.content: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics are officially underway after Friday's opening ceremony. Plus, the latest on the investigation into Nancy Guthrie's disappearance.

items.title: Inside the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics opening ceremony
items.standfirst: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics marked its official start on Friday with an opening ceremony that included the traditional Parade of Nations and performances from Mariah Carey and Andrea Bocelli. "CBS Saturday Morning" goes inside the event.
items.content: The Milano Cortina Winter Olympics marked its official start on Friday with an opening ceremony that included the traditional Parade of Nations and performances from Mariah Carey and Andrea Bocelli. "CBS Saturday Morning" goes inside the event.

items.title: Setting the scene at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics

items.content: "CBS Saturday Morning" explores Northern Italy and breaks down the multiple locations of the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

items.title: Milan–Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics officially underway
items.standfirst: The 2026 Winter Olympics reached its first major milestone with a unique opening ceremony held simultaneously in Milan, Cortina, Livigno and Predazzo.
items.content: The 2026 Winter Olympics reached its first major milestone with a unique opening ceremony held simultaneously in Milan, Cortina, Livigno and Predazzo.

items.title: Milan Cortina opening ceremony's best moments
items.standfirst: The Milan-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics opened Friday with a glittering ceremony at the San Siro stadium featuring US pop diva Mariah Carey, Italian tenor Andrea Bocelli and Chinese pianist Lang Lang among other performers. It was accompanied by celebrations at Games venues across the Italian Alps in an unprecedented four-site, dual-cauldron opening ceremony. Morgan Ayre and Jean Barrère take a closer look.
items.content: The Milan-Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics opened Friday with a glittering ceremony at the San Siro stadium featuring US pop diva Mariah Carey, Italian tenor Andrea Bocelli and Chinese pianist Lang Lang among other performers. clusters.neutral_headline: Haiti Transitional Council Hands Power To Prime Minister

items.title: Haiti’s transitional council hands power to US-backed prime minister
items.standfirst: Move comes after council tried to oust PM Fils-Aime and the US recently deployed warship to waters near Haiti’s capital.
items.content: Move comes after council tried to oust PM Fils-Aime and the US recently deployed warship to waters near Haiti’s capital.

items.title: Haiti’s transitional council transfers power to US-backed prime minister Fils-Aimé
items.standfirst: Haiti’s presidential transitional council on Saturday handed over power to US-backed Prime Minister Alix Didier Fils-Aimé as the country prepares for its first general elections in a decade. The council was created two years ago, but has been unable to quell the gang violence plaguing the Caribbean nation.
items.content: Haiti’s presidential transitional council on Saturday handed over power to US-backed Prime Minister Alix Didier Fils-Aimé as the country prepares for its first general elections in a decade. The council was created two years ago, but has been unable to quell the gang violence plaguing the Caribbean nation.

ai_summary: Haiti's transitional council transfers power

items.content: The United States National Security Agency (NSA) detected a phone call last year between an individual linked to foreign intelligence and someone close to US President Donald Trump, the Guardian repor...

items.title: NSA detected phone call between foreign intelligence and a person close to Trump
items.standfirst: Whistleblower says that Tulsi Gabbard blocked agency from sharing report and delivered it to White House chief of staffLast spring, the National Security Agency (NSA) detected evidence of an unusual phone call between an individual associated with foreign intelligence and a person close to Donald Trump, according to a whistleblower’s attorney briefed on the existence of the call.The highly sensitive communique, which has roiled Washington over the past week, was brought to the attention of the director of national intelligence (DNI), Tulsi Gabbard – but rather than allowing NSA officials to distribute the information further, she took a paper copy of the intelligence directly to the president’s chief of staff, Susie Wiles, the attorney, Andrew Bakaj, said. Continue reading...
items.content: Whistleblower says that Tulsi Gabbard blocked agency from sharing report and delivered it to White House chief of staffLast spring, the National Security Agency (NSA) detected evidence of an unusual phone call between an individual associated with foreign intelligence and a person close to Donald Trump, according to a whistleblower’s attorney briefed on the existence of the call.The highly sensitive communique, which has roiled Washington over the past week, was brought to the attention of the director of national intelligence (DNI), Tulsi Gabbard – but rather than allowing NSA officials to distribute the information further, she took a paper copy of the intelligence directly to the president’s chief of staff, Susie Wiles, the attorney, Andrew Bakaj, said. Continue reading...

ai_summary: NSA detects unusual phone call in 2023

Whistleblower reports call to director of national intelligence
Call sparks controversy and investigation
Details of the call remain classified

clusters.title: John McTernan: Mandelson sharing sensitive information with Epstein "feels treasonous"
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Police Search Properties Linked to Peter Mandelson

items.title: John McTernan: Mandelson sharing sensitive information with Epstein "feels treasonous"
items.standfirst: In the UK, pressure is mounting on Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer as his judgement is questioned over the appointment of Peter Mandelson as US ambassador, despite concerns about Mandelson’s past links. With the controversy deepening and the political stakes rising, France 24’s Gavin Lee is joined by John McTernan to examine the fallout and what it means for Labour’s leadership.
items.content: In the UK, pressure is mounting on Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer as his judgement is questioned over the appointment of Peter Mandelson as US ambassador, despite concerns about Mandelson’s past links. With the controversy deepening and the political stakes rising, France 24’s Gavin Lee is joined by John McTernan to examine the fallout and what it means for Labour’s leadership.

items.title: Starmer leadership speculation ‘serious’ but task ahead ‘very clear’, says Brown – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closedAmid mounting speculation that Keir Starmer could quit over the Mandelson scandal, Gordon Brown has described the prime minister as a “man of integrity” but said he faced a “serious” challenge to remain in his role.Police officers probing accusations relating to Peter Mandelson’s links with Jeffrey Epstein have concluded their search of two properties connected to the Labour peer in London and Wiltshire.Met police said its investigation “will take some time” and that “a significant amount of further evidence gathering and analysis” was needed.The Liberal Democrats have urged the Financial Conduct Authority to immediately investigate Mandelson, saying his apparent decision to leak highly confidential government information to Epstein may have led to insider trading.Brown said the alleged leaks put Britain “at risk” and could have caused “huge commercial damage”.The Metropolitan police has provided an update on the searches of two properties linked to Mandelson. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closedAmid mounting speculation that Keir Starmer could quit over the Mandelson scandal, Gordon Brown has described the prime minister as a “man of integrity” but said he faced a “serious” challenge to remain in his role.Police officers probing accusations relating to Peter Mandelson’s links with Jeffrey Epstein have concluded their search of two properties connected to the Labour peer in London and Wiltshire.Met police said its investigation “will take some time” and that “a significant amount of further evidence gathering and analysis” was needed.The Liberal Democrats have urged the Financial Conduct Authority to immediately investigate Mandelson, saying his apparent decision to leak highly confidential government information to Epstein may have led to insider trading.Brown said the alleged leaks put Britain “at risk” and could have caused “huge commercial damage”.The Metropolitan police has provided an update on the searches of two properties linked to Mandelson. Continue reading...

items.title: UK police search two properties linked to Mandelson
items.standfirst: Revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein files are shaking British politics, as UK police search two properties linked to Lord Peter Mandelson, the Labour MP and former UK ambassador to the United States, as part of an investigation into potential misconduct in public office. The development has renewed pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his 2024 decision to appoint Mandelson as Washington envoy, despite his known ties to the convicted sex offender. Liza Kaminov examines what the latest Epstein files reveal about Lord Mandelson.
items.content: Revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein files are shaking British politics, as UK police search two properties linked to Lord Peter Mandelson, the Labour MP and former UK ambassador to the United States, as part of an investigation into potential misconduct in public office. The development has renewed pressure on Prime Minister Keir Starmer over his 2024 decision to appoint Mandelson as Washington envoy, despite his known ties to the convicted sex offender. Liza Kaminov examines what the latest Epstein files reveal about Lord Mandelson.

ai_summary: Police search properties linked to Mandelson
Investigation into potential misconduct in office
Mandelson's links to Jeffrey Epstein under scrutiny
Allegations of leaked confidential information
Police say investigation will take significant time

items.title: Why has Elon Musk merged his rocket company with his AI startup?
items.standfirst: SpaceX’s acquisition of xAI creates business worth $1.25tn but whether premise behind deal will work is questionedThe acquisition of xAI by SpaceX is a typical Elon Musk deal: big numbers backed by big ambition.As well as extending “the light of consciousness to the stars”, as Musk described it, the transaction creates a business worth $1.25tn (£920bn) by combining Musk’s rocket company with his artificial intelligence startup. It values SpaceX at $1tn and xAI at $250bn, with a stock market flotation expected in June to time with Musk’s birthday and a planetary alignment. Continue reading...
items.content: SpaceX’s acquisition of xAI creates business worth $1.25tn but whether premise behind deal will work is questionedThe acquisition of xAI by SpaceX is a typical Elon Musk deal: big numbers backed by big ambition.As well as extending “the light of consciousness to the stars”, as Musk described it, the transaction creates a business worth $1.25tn (£920bn) by combining Musk’s rocket company with his artificial intelligence startup. It values SpaceX at $1tn and xAI at $250bn, with a stock market flotation expected in June to time with Musk’s birthday and a planetary alignment. Continue reading...
